NEET 3 - Physics - 5Q - The motion of a particle is described by V = at2. Then find the distance travelled by the particle in first 2 second
questions.explanation:
V = at2

$ rac{dx}{dt} = at^2$

$ herefore \int_{0}^{x} dx = \int_{0}^{2} at^2dt$

$\Rightarrow x = a[ rac{t^3}{3}]_0^2$

∴ x = ${8a}/{3}$

questions.question:
IIT JEE MAIN - Test Series 5 - Physics - 7Q -
Find the flux due to charge through curved surface of cylinder.
questions.explanation:
Flux through curved surface = ${Q}/{ε_0}$ − (flux through both disc)

$ rac{Q}{\epsilon_{0}} − rac{Q}{2\epsilon_{0}}(1 − \cos heta_{1}) − rac{Q}{2\epsilon_{0}}(1 − \cos heta_{2})$

$ rac{Q}{2\epsilon_{0}}(\cos heta_{1} + \cos heta_{2})$

$ rac{Q}{2\epsilon_{0}}( rac{L/4}{\sqrt{R^{2} + ( rac{L}{4})^{2}}} + rac{3L/4}{\sqrt{R^{2} + ( rac{3L}{4})^{2}}})$

$ rac{Q}{2\epsilon_{0}}( rac{L}{\sqrt{(4R)^{2} + L^{2}}} + rac{3L}{\sqrt{(4R)^{2} + (3L)^{2}}})$

questions.question: IIT JEE MAIN - Test Series 5 - Maths - 2Q Solution - If in the Expansion of $(4^{x} +  rac{1}{16^{x}})^{n}$, n∈N, ${T_3}/{T_2}$ = 7 and the sum of the coefficients of 2<sup>nd</sup> and 3<sup>rd</sup> terms is 36, then the value of x is equal to (T<sub>i</sub> denote the i<sup>th</sup> term of Expansion)

IIT JEE MAIN - Test Series 5 - Maths - 5Q Solution - Let $f(x) =  rac{1 − \cos\lbrace x brace}{(x^{3} − 6x^{2} + 11x − 6)^{2}}$. If $l = \lim_{x ightarrow 1^{ + }}f(x)$, $m = \lim_{x ightarrow 2^{ + }}f(x)$ and $n = \lim_{x ightarrow 3^{ + }}f(x)$, Where {.} denotes fractional part function, then
questions.explanation:
$f(x) = rac{1 − \cos\lbrace x brace}{(x − 1)^{2}(x − 2)^{2}(x − 3)^{2}}$

$l = \lim_{x ightarrow 1^{ + }}f(x) = \lim_{x ightarrow 1^{ + }} rac{1 − \cos\lbrace x − 1 brace}{(x − 1)^{2}(x − 2)^{2}(x − 3)^{2}} = rac{1}{2 imes 1 imes 4} = rac{1}{8}$

$m = \lim_{x ightarrow 2^{ + }}f(x) = \lim_{x ightarrow 2^{ + }} rac{1 − \cos\lbrace x − 2 brace}{(x − 1)^{2}(x − 2)^{2}(x − 3)^{2}} = rac{1}{2} imes rac{1}{1 imes 1} = rac{1}{2}$

$n = \lim_{x ightarrow 3^{ + }}f(x) = \lim_{x ightarrow 3^{ + }} rac{1 − \cos\lbrace x − 3 brace}{(x − 1)^{2}(x − 2)^{2}(x − 3)^{2}} = rac{1}{2} imes rac{1}{4 imes 1} = rac{1}{8}$

questions.question: IIT JEE MAIN - Test Series 5 - Maths - 11Q Solution - If $\vec{a}$, $\vec{b}$ and \vec{c} are non−coplanar vectors and $\vec{a}×\vec{c}$ is perpendicular to $\vec{a} × (\vec{b} × \vec{c})$ , then the angle between \vec{a} and \vec{c} is
questions.explanation:
--- Arrow Test ---$(\vec{a} imes\:\vec{c})$ is perpendicular to $\vec{a} imes(\vec{b} imes\:\vec{c})$

So,

$(\vec{a} imes\:\vec{c}).(\vec{a} imes\:(\vec{b} imes\vec{c})) = 0$

$(\vec{a} imes\:\vec{c}).((\vec{a}.\vec{c})\vec{b}−(\vec{a}.\vec{b})\vec{c}) = 0$

$(\vec{a}.\vec{c})((\vec{a} imes\vec{c}).\vec{b})−(\vec{a}.\:\vec{b})((\vec{a} imes\vec{c}).\vec{c}) = 0$

$(\vec{a}.\vec{c})((\vec{a} imes\vec{c}).\vec{b}) = 0$

$( ecause\:(\vec{a} imes\vec{c}).\vec{c} = 0)$

Since,$(\vec{a},\vec{b},\vec{c})$ are coplanar vectors

So,$(\vec{a} imes\vec{c}).\vec{b} eq0$

$\Rightarrow\:\vec{a}.\vec{c} = 0$

angle between $\vec{a}$ and $\vec{c}$ is 90°

questions.question: IIT JEE MAIN - Test Series 5 - Maths - 12Q Solution - If the straight line x + y + z + 3 = 0 = ax + by + cz + 2 is parallel to the plane a<sup>3</sup>x + b<sup>3</sup>y + c<sup>3</sup>z = 4 then (Where a,b,c are distinct numbers)
questions.explanation:
--- Matrix Testing --- Equation of line is x + y + z + 3 = 0 = ax + by + cz + 2

Direction ration of the line is $ egin{bmatrix}\hat{i} & \hat{j} & \hat{k} \1 & 1 & 1 \ a & b & c \end{bmatrix}$

Lets say $\vec{n_{1}} = egin{bmatrix}\hat{i} & \hat{j} & \hat{k} \1 & 1 & 1 \ a & b & c \end{bmatrix}$

Line is parallel to plane $a^{3}x + b^{3}x + c^{3}x = 4$

Let direction ratios of normal to the plane is $\vec{n_{2}}$

$\vec{n_{2}} = (a^{3}\hat{i} + b^{3}\hat{j} + c^{3}\hat{k})$

line is parallel to plane so, $\vec{n_{1}}.\vec{n_{2}} = 0$

$\Rightarrow egin{bmatrix}1 & 1 & 1 \a & b & c \ a^{3} & b^{3} & c^{3} \end{bmatrix} = 0$

$(a − b)(b − c)(c − a)(a + b + c) = 0$

Since a,b,c are distinct numbers

so, a + b + c + = 0
